Description: Let’s learn if we should use C# records as model classes with EF Core and some of the potential pros and cons of this approach.

Title: Span / Memory / ReadOnlySequence in C#
Description: There are many different memory types used in modern C# programs. The more common ones are Span<T> and Memory<T>. Occasionally there is also ReadOnlySequence<T>. What do these types do?

Title: New Release: Media Player Element on Mobile, Web, Linux. WebView2 Support

Title: More Unit Testing with Less Code - Combinatorial Unit Testing
On AWS Shutting Down Open Source Documentation
Description: I am both surprised and not surprised - AWS announced (close to a month ago) the fact that they are retiring the AWS documentation on GitHub.

Title: .NET Rocks! OpenTelemetry with Laïla Bougriâ
Description: What can OpenTelemetry do for you? While at Techorama in Belgium, Carl and Richard talked to Laïla Bougriâ about her experiences with the open-source library that can help give you more insight into the behavior of your applications. Laïla talks about being able to instrument your applications from top-to-bottom, regardless of platforms or development stacks. The conversation digs into the differences between logging, tracing, and telemetry - and how each aspect adds value to understand what your applications are doing, and how you can make them better!

Title: Scanning Azure VMs, Azure Arc-enabled servers and ACR images for vulnerabilities with Microsoft Defender and Qualys
Description: In this blog post we'll look into how we can use integrated Qualys scanner in MS Defender for vulnerability assessment of Azure Arc-enabled servers and other applicable resources.
